properties.areaDesc: Eastern/Central El Paso County; Salt Basin; Otero Mesa; Northern Hudspeth Highlands/Hueco Mountains; Southwest Desert/Mimbres Basin; Southern Tularosa Basin; Southern Dona Ana County/Mesilla Valley; Western El Paso County
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 1:58PM MST until February 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM CONTINUES TO BRING WIDESPREAD SNOWFALL ACROSS
MOUNTAINS AND LOWLANDS...

Falling afternoon temperatures has allowed for rain to change to
snow over portions of Luna, Sierra, and Dona Ana Counties in
southern New Mexico. Continued precipitation will result in
accumulations worthy of an advisory in those areas. 1-3" of
snowfall is possible along I-25 and I-10 east of Deming. Additional
snowfall over the mountains is expected this evening, with 4-8"
of new snow possible. Snow will begin to taper off early Wednesday
morning.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches.
Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest New Mexico and
southwest Texas.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Advisory has been extended over Las Cruces
and the El Paso metro. Rain will change over to snow shortly,
with accumulating snowfall this evening.

* TIMING... Occasional moderate to heavy snow through early
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS... Travel could become difficult as roadways may be
slick and snow covered.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY
